benchmark_details.name: NeedleBench
benchmark_details.overview: NeedleBench is a comprehensive synthetic framework designed to assess retrieval and reasoning performance in bilingual long-context tasks with adaptive context lengths, categorizing tasks into information-sparse and information-dense scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate large language models on their retrieval and reasoning capabilities across varying information densities and context lengths.

data.source: Synthetic data generated according to the NeedleBench framework.

methodology.calculation: Score is calculated based on predefined sets of core keywords compared to the model's predictions, averaging across different experimental dimensions and configurations.
methodology.interpretation: A higher score indicates better retrieval and reasoning capabilities, while lower scores indicate difficulties in handling long-context information.
methodology.validation: Evaluation is repeated multiple times to enhance result stability.
